snippet: In a case against three foreign men charged with supporting a Somali terrorist group, documents offer a glimpse of the government’s rationale for bringing such cases into the federal courts.
abstract: Details emerge in terrorism case in Federal District Court in Brooklyn against Madhi Hashi, Mohamed Yusuf and Ali Yasin Ahmed, who were arrested overseas and charged with supporting Somali terrorist group Al Shabab; court documents offer glimpse of government’s rationale for bringing suspects accused of being foreign terrorists into federal court system.
lead_paragraph: In a case against three foreign men charged with supporting a Somali terrorist group, documents offer a glimpse of the government’s rationale for bringing such cases into the federal courts.

headline.seo: Court Papers Offer Glimpse of Government Rationale in Federal Terror Cases
headline.main: Court Papers Offer Details in Terror Case
headline.print_headline: Court Papers Offer Details In Terror Case
